crazyhamster03 wrote:
> 
> Thanks, I'd really appreciate it. I'll see what I can do about
> getting in touch with him.

I'm new to Q learning (since reading your post here a few days ago). 
I've read about it a bit, and wonder how useful it is for thing other 
than state diagram path-finding.

Anyway.. I wonder if you might just use NEAT to evolve the Q matrix 
indirectly (similar to HyperNEAT)?  Still, with that, I wonder if 
Q-learning might be faster or more efficient..

Anyway, I'm curious about the topic.

--Steve
